repnme.cdata!:
Azerbaijan - Providing adequate and prompt
            pension and social insurance payments

abstracts.cdata!:
For the first time in the post-Soviet
            era, Azerbaijan introduced a new targeted social assistance
            (TSA) program which, as of February 2011, provided 9.3
            percent of households (173,206 families with 791,029
            members) with TSA. The program has substantially reduced
            poverty: for each percent of gross domestic product (GDP)
            spent on TSA, poverty incidence declines by 2.8 percent. In
            addition, as a result of the project, pensioners now receive
            their pensions in full and on time, compared to the
            pre-project level of 50 percent, and the number of those
            contributing to the social security system increased by 40
            percent between 2003 and 2011 from 1.3 million to 1.87
            million people. World Bank-financed social protection
            development project which aims to improve the delivery of
            labor market and social protection interventions through
            strengthened institutions, enhanced institutional and human
            resources capacity, and improved targeting of social safety
            net programs.

Azerbaijan - Providing adequate and prompt

For the first time in the post-Soviet
            era, Azerbaijan introduced a new Targeted Social Assistance
            (TSA) program which, as of February 2011, provided 9.3
            percent of households (173,206 families with 791,029
            members) with TSA. The program has substantially reduced
            poverty: for each percent of GDP spent on TSA, poverty
            incidence declines by 2.8 percent. In addition, as a result
            of the project, pensioners now receive their pensions in
            full and on time, compared to the preproject level of 50
            percent, and the number of those contributing to the social
            security system increased by 40 percent between 2003 and
            2011 from 1.3 million to 1.87 million people.

            SOCIAL PROTECTION PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
This Results Profile talks about the
            technology that improved Azerbaijani social safety. The
            Pension and Social Assistance Project, supported by the
            World Bank, was designed to support for modernization,
            automation and staff training in the dispersion of insurance
            based pension. Greater transparency was one of the most
            important gains in the project. The project also helped
            design and implement Azerbaijan's successful Targeted
            Social Assistance Program which has reduced the poverty
            tremendously during the past decade, from about 50 percent
            of population to less than 15 percent.

repnme.cdata!: Azerbaijan - Pension and Social Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Pension and Social
            Assistance Project for Azerbaijan were as follows: outcomes
            were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was low or
            negligible, Bank performance was satisfactory, and borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            included: reform is concerned not only with technical and
            institutional improvements, but relies heavily on the
            political process. Leadership and ownership of the reforms
            pursued by the project were crucial to its success. In the
            case of the Project, there was strong commitment not only
            from the Minister of the Ministry of Labor and Social
            Protection of the Population (MLSPP) and the Chairman of the
            State Social Protection Fund, but also from the Ministries
            of Finance and Economy to bring about reform which were
            crucial in the adoption of legislation and amendments to
            pertinent laws and regulatory acts. The probability of
            success in any reform is higher where there is a reform
            champion, but broader support is needed for sustainability.
            To institutionalize new systems, processes and practices
            ensuring sustainability of ownership by the implementing
            agencies is also essential. Providing continuous guidance
            and actively engaging with counterparts in seeking solutions
            to challenges as they arose was critical in the successful
            implementation of the Project. A focus on identifying
            problems and seeking solutions as a coherent, collaborative
            World Bank client team was important for achieving results.
            With limited experience in implementation of the World
            Bank's procurement guidelines and financial management
            requirements, it was important for the World Bank to provide
            on-the-job training and to make available training
            courses/workshops to build the capacity of the PIUs in
            procurement and financial management. Good Public Relations
            (PR) campaigns on ongoing reforms earned civil society trust
            in the reform. In the case of the Project, the government
            reached out to the population to gather information on the
            performance of the system and used it to improve their
            performance. It made a consistent effort to implement
            information campaigns to convey to the general public the
            content of the reforms under implementation, build trust in
            the public sector and enhance accountability. Developing
            adequate monitoring systems is crucial for the
            sustainability of the programs. The Project supported the
            development of databases and the Management Information
            System (MIS) for both institutions as basic tools to improve
            efficiency and effectiveness of the social protection
            programs. The leadership of both institutions was committed
            to continue deepening the efforts to develop their
            monitoring and evaluation systems to sustain the system and
            programs in the long term. The ongoing Social Protection
            Development Project (SPDP) is further supporting these efforts.

repnme.cdata!: Azerbaijan - Pension and Social Assistance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Pension and Social Assistance
            Project for Azerbaijan aims to significantly improve
            effectiveness and transparency in the providing public
            pensions and social assistance to eligible beneficiaries.
            The project has three components: Component 1 strengthens
            social assistance administration. Activities include
            implementation of a Management Information System (MIS) to
            support means and asset testing for eligibility for social
            welfare programs; implementation of targeted social welfare
            programs; and enhancing policy analysis capacity in the
            Ministry of Labor and Social Protection of the Population
            (MLSPP) for social protection. Component 2 strengthens the
            social insurance administration. This component includes
            civil works and the provision of equipment, materials,
            technical assistance and training for the following
            activities: implementation of a Management Information
            System (MIS) to support the establishment of a client data
            base of individual records (a central register); operational
            improvements in key business processes related to the use of
            the central register-- contributions collections, revenue
            and expenditure monitoring, audit/inspection, pension
            management, client services; and institutional
            strengthening, including governance arrangements, general
            and financial management, human resource management,
            actuarial forecasting and policy analysis, and public
            information. Component 3 comprises project management, and
            monitoring and evaluation.
